body.name: ASUS WS X299 SAGE LGA2066 DDR4 M.2 U.2 X299 CEB Motherboard for Intel Core X-Series Processors with Quad-GPU Support, DDR4 4200MHz, Dual M.2 & U.2 Support
body.stockDetail: Only 2 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 17 hrs 26 mins.
features: Designed for 7th generation LGA2066 socket Intel Core X-Series processors with dual M.2 and U.2, front panel USB 3.1 Gen2, Dual Gigabit Intel LAN, support for Thunderbolt 3, Intel VROC and Intel Optane Memory compatibility

Oc design featuring ASUS ProClock and T-Topology technology extends CPU and memory overclocking margins while providing the flexibility to extract every ounce of performance for memory speeds of ddr4-4200 MHz and beyond

7x PCIe x16 slots with patent-pending Safe Slot feature an injection molding process that integrates metal framing for stronger, firmly anchored PCIe Slots built for heavyweight GPUs, ideal for supporting 4-way NVIDIASLI or AMD Crossfire

5-Way Optimization featuring Auto-Tuning and FanXpert 4 delivers automatic overclocking profiles for maximum OC performance while headers for thermal sensors, AIO pump, and water cooling provide dynamic system cooling

Complete it infrastructure management with ASMB9 out-of-band remote management and in-band ASUS control Center providing a complete server management solution reducing it operating costs with features like remote BIOS updating, monitoring multiple systems via a mobile device, and one-click software updates/Dispatching
body.description: Designed for performance, The ASUS WS X299 SAGE delivers advanced overclocking control with ASUS ProClock and T-Topology technology. Safe Slot protection on 7x PCIe slots Supports 4-way NVIDIA SLI or AMD Crossfire, while dual M.2 and USB 3.1 provide optimized data speeds. Personalize your system with Aura Sync RGB lighting headers.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.0 4.0 out of 5 stars 26 ratings 4.0 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The new WS X299 Sage blends tremendous GPU performance with up to Quad-SLI support, server-grade validation, and comprehensive cooling options to deliver the perfect system build for training neural networks and crunching other scalable compute loads. Dual PLX chips extend the number of PCIe lanes to provide additional expansion slots, giving you robust connectivity options to configure your system with the tools you need to get your job done. Multi-GPU support WS X299 Sage fits up to four dual-slot graphics cards and supports both NVIDIA SLI and AMD CrossFireX 4-way configurations to enable multi-GPU setups that harness the full power of the latest graphics technologies, including NVIDIA Quadro. With performance beyond 15.23 TFLOPS*, NVIDIA Quadro is the perfect complement to WS X299 Sage, delivering the best performance for design, modeling, medical research, and processing-intensive simulation and rendering applications. *In double-precision floating-point tests. 5-Way Optimization ASUS 5-Way Optimization makes your workstation smart. One click takes care of complex tuning, dynamically optimizing essential aspects of the system to provide overclocking and cooling profiles that are tailored for your rig. An automated tuning utility that optimizes overclocking and cooling profiles for your unique system configuration. Fans stay whisper-quiet with everyday computing, and deliver optimal airflow when the system is crunching through CPU or GPU-intensive tasks. Stress test function helps optimize and overclock for CPU- or memory-centric workloads.

Quad-GPU graphics power: Fits up to four dual-slot graphics cards and supports 4-way NVIDIA SLI or AMD CrossFireX GPU configurations.5-Way Optimization: One-click, system-wide tuning, delivers optimized overclocking and intelligent cooling for a diverse range of workloads.Industry-leading cooling options: Comprehensive controls for fans and water pumps, via Fan Xpert 4 software or the acclaimed ASUS UEFI.Ultra-efficient VRM heatsink: Metal-fin-array design maximizes surface area for heat dissipation to enable unthrottled performance.ASUS Control Center: A software utility that provides convenient, secure and cost-saving centralized IT management for small- and medium-sized businesses.Ultra-fast storage: Up to 32Gbps dual M.2 and U.2, plus up to 10Gbps USB 3.1 Gen 2 with Type-A and Type-C ports onboard and a front-panel connector.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It is awesome!
reviews.reviewText: Love the board it has a lot of cool stuff on it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great board for deep learning
reviews.reviewText: Pros:PLX chip lets you run 4 cards in PCIE 16x.Great BIOS. The BIOS has all the features I was looking for and almost all of them were in sensible locations with sensible names and descriptions.One click overclock works well and overclocked my 9800x to 4.6ghz all cores without any heat issues.The board accepted my 9800x even with the older bios that came in the box. The bios came out before the 9800x was announced and I was worried I would have to get another cpu to be able to update the bios to accept it. That wasn't a problem though!Cons:The board would not post with my ram set to XMP (3733 MHz). I had to clock the ram down to 3200 MHz to get it to boot. The same ram worked fine in my z370 board at XMP settings (though the ram was in dual channel on that board and quad channel on this board).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's a good board with some quirks
reviews.reviewText: I tried putting this in a 900 be quiet! case and for a first build, it went relatively smoothly. I can easily fit 3-4 dual slot GPU's on this. So far I haven't had any issues.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2018
reviews.reviewText: I do 3D Animation/Motion Graphic work and I have to say...WOW!!! Excellent board!!!! New 0502 bios fixed a lot of initial release issues. Aura is now working perfectly, the new bios updated the aura lighting programming. The trick with the x299 series and this particular board for me at least was to set the cpu cores to specific core and leave everything else on auto including leave the Asus Multi Core setting to auto. This fixed all turbo boost 3.0 issues and GPU throttling issues. My benchmarks and real world performance has significantly increased with the new bios update along with the setting adjustment. Everything is rock solid stable and lightning fast. Before it seems like something was hitting the brakes but not now. For the current price of this board, it is excellent especially if you need more pci-e lanes as this contains dual plx chips. I hope intel continues a 2nd round of processors for the LGA 2066 socket and doesn't screw everyone and make you buy a new x399 intel platform like the roadmap indicates. Solid choice and in my opinion, more stable than the Gigabyte Designare EX motherboard which is the equivalent to this. Boxx tech is using the designare board in almost all x299 builds, I hope they switch to this as I trust Asus motherboards much more than Gigabyte especially for content creation workloads. Cheers!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2018
reviews.reviewText: I own two of these boards in identical systems and it is awesome. Never had a problem with anything. Why are you leaving a one start review because your can't read a manual? How about your try the motherboard for how it's made them do a review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Item in ruff shape
reviews.reviewText: Hope it works. Heat pipes looks like someone tried something with vice grips used. No back plate and the bio button completely missing. Is in ruff shape for the price payed.
